channel.title: Pc Problem?
channel.description:
Anyone know why this is occurring. This is after a restart running nothing.
[img]http://i.imgur.com/eKJhZOe.png[/img]
Note: Computer is 5-6 years old.

item.title: Pc Problem?
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

You can open resource monitor and go to the disk tab to get a more accurate reading of what is using it all.

Read full topic

item.title: Pc Problem?
item.dc:creator: @Travas Travas
item.description:
@Travas wrote:

First thing I would do is check to see what is set to run on start-up and disable anything you don’t absolutely need.

Read full topic

item.title: Pc Problem?
item.dc:creator: @naseem142 naseem142
item.description:
@naseem142 wrote:

This is probably the Microsoft anti virus running a scan on your PC that takes up that huge disk percentage , if you look down you should find “Antimalware service executable” with high disk load. You can disable this auto scan via settings i think somewhere ( google it ) , I used to have this problem until i upgraded to an SSD , even a 128gb SSD does wonders if you put your windows on it and everything else on an HDD.

If it’s not the case , then try investigating further down and see what is taking so much disk load and try to deal with it i guess.

Read full topic
